avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Windslab will be deposited overnight on steep South, through South-West to North-West aspects above 850 metres. Isolated deposits will be most sensitive at higher elevations where they achieve depth in very steep terrain, such as gully tops, coire rims and convexities. Outwith these areas the snowpack will be stable in most locations. Fragile cornices will continue to build. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 13.12. Isolated windslab deposits, S,SW,W,NW aspects above 850 metres. Fragile cornices. Avalanche Hazard Moderate.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Overnight snow, falling above 800 metres is expected, followed by a dry day. Winds will be very strong and from the East-North-East overnight, decreasing to become fresh from the South-East by midday. The freezing level is expected to be around 800 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: A day of poor visibility with light rain falling as snow above 950 metres. The freezing level was around 1100 metres. Winds were strong and mainly from the East-South-East.
ObservedSnowStability: Isolated shallow accumulations of windslab can be found on South-West, West and North-West aspects above 1000 metres. Outwith these areas the snowpack is moist and consolidated in most locations, with a widespread soft crust. Cornices are present above Northerly aspects around coire rims. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: SAIS daily public avalanche reports ended on 16th April 2023. Snowpack conditions will be monitored but it is expected that no further public avalanche reports will be issued. Thank you for your support. With thanks from the SAIS team.
avalancheActivity.highlights: 16.4.23: SAIS reports ended for this season. Conditions will be monitored but it\'s expected that no reports will be issued. Thanks.
